text: James Elbert "Tootie" Robbins (June 2, 1958 â€“ August 2, 2020) was an American professional football player. He was an offensive tackle for 12 seasons in the National Football League (NFL) for the St. Louis/Phoenix Cardinals and the Green Bay Packers. Robbins was born in Windsor, North Carolina. Robbins died on August 2, 2020 from COVID-19 in Chandler, Arizona at the age of 62.Former Packers Tackle Tootie Robbins Dies After Coronavirus Diagnosis: 'He Is Definitely Missed' ==References== Category:1958 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Arizona Category:American football offensive tackles Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Green Bay Packers players Category:Sportspeople from North Carolina
title: Tootie Robbins
